Detailed Description

The class provides event data.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

EventsProvider::EventsProvider ( KURL  fileUrl,
int  currentSamplingRate,
int  position = 25 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
fileUrl the url of the event file containing the event ids.
currentSamplingRate sampling rate of the current file.
position represents the percentage from the begining of the window where the events are display when browsing.

Member Function Documentation

void EventsProvider::requestData ( long  startTime,
long  endTime,
QObject *  initiator,
long  startTimeInRecordingUnits = 0 
) [virtual]

Triggers the retrieve of the events included in the time interval given by startTime and endTime.

Parameters:
startTime begining of the time interval from which to retrieve the data in miliseconds.
endTime end of the time interval from which to retrieve the data.
initiator instance requesting the data.
startTimeInRecordingUnits begining of the time interval from which to retrieve the data in recording units.

Reimplemented from DataProvider.

void EventsProvider::requestNextEventData ( long  startTime,
long  timeFrame,
QValueList< int >  selectedIds,
QObject *  initiator 
)

Looks up for the first of the events included in the list selectedIds existing after the time startTime.

All the events included in the time interval given by timeFrame are retrieved. The time interval start time is computed in order to have the first event found located at eventPosition percentage of the time interval.

Parameters:
startTime starting time for the look up.
timeFrame time interval for which to retrieve the data.
selectedIds list of event ids to look up for.
initiator instance requesting the data.

void EventsProvider::requestPreviousEventData ( long  endTime,
long  timeFrame,
QValueList< int >  selectedIds,
QObject *  initiator 
)

Looks up for the first of the events included in the list selectedIds existing before the time endTime.

All the events included in the time interval given by timeFrame are retrieved. The time interval start time is computed in order to have the first event found located at eventPosition percentage of the time interval.

Parameters:
endTime starting time for the look up.
timeFrame time interval for which to retrieve the data.
selectedIds list of event ids to look up for.
initiator instance requesting the data.

int EventsProvider::loadData (  ) 

Loads the event ids and the corresponding spike time.

bool EventsProvider::isModified (  )  const [inline]

Tells if the event file has been modified at least since the last save.

Returns:
true if the file has been modified, false otherwise.

void EventsProvider::initializeEmptyProvider (  ) 

Initializes the provider as it is the provider of a new empty event file.

Default description length is 2 characters

void EventsProvider::dataReady ( Array< dataType > &  times,
Array< int > &  ids,
QObject *  initiator,
QString  providerName 
) [signal]

Signals that the data have been retrieved.

Parameters:
times 1 line array containing the time (in recording samples) of each event existing in the requested time frame.
ids 1 line array containing the identifiers of each event existing in the requested time frame.
initiator instance requesting the data.
providerName name of the instance providing the data.
